The claim originated from State Sen: Amanda Chase, who has a history of spreading discredited statements about the election being "stolen" from President Donald Trump.
The claim was not supported by any subst: Chase simply linked her post to a video of protesters at the Capitol chanting "No antifa," without providing any further proof.
The claim was part of a larger trend of: results deniers blaming the violence on far-left activists impersonating Trump supporters. This fabricated charge has been spread on social media sites and by Republican politicians, but has been rated as false by fact-checkers.
The mention of: antifa" started to gain traction on online platforms like 4chan and social media groups after the riot at the Capitol, but there is no credible evidence to support the claim that antifa was responsible for the violence.
